questions.text: What are the primary disadvantages of cryptographic solutions for privacy protection? Select all that apply.
options: Inference possibility remains uncertain in all scenarios
Security guarantees are absolute in all cases
questions.correctAnswer:
Inference possibility remains uncertain in all scenarios
It is expensive

questions.text: Why do anonymization techniques often fail to provide adequate privacy protection?
options: Adversaries can leverage auxiliary databases for de-anonymization attacks
They only work with structured data formats
The anonymization process introduces too much noise
questions.correctAnswer: Adversaries can leverage auxiliary databases for de-anonymization attacks

questions.text: In the randomized response model, what does the parameter epsilon in $e^{\epsilon}$ represent?
options: The percentage of truthfulness of the response that is allowed to be revealed
The ratio between falsehood and randomness in responses
The computational complexity of the algorithm
The number of participants in the study
questions.correctAnswer: The percentage of truthfulness of the response that is allowed to be revealed

questions.text: What characterizes an ideal privacy model?
options: Maximum utility with zero privacy guarantees
Balanced trade-off between utility and privacy requirements
Complete data suppression for absolute privacy
questions.correctAnswer: Balanced trade-off between utility and privacy requirements

questions.text: Given: $X_i$ represents truth, $Y_i$ represents randomized value of $X_i$, and $Z_i = (Y_i - (1/(1 + e^{\epsilon}))) \times (e^{\epsilon} + 1)/(e^{\epsilon} - 1)$, What is the expected value $E[Z_i]$?
In the randomized response model, which statements are correct? Select all that apply.
options: Privacy guarantee can be controlled by parameter $\epsilon$
Privacy and utility are independent of sample size
questions.correctAnswer:
Privacy guarantee can be controlled by parameter $\epsilon$
Utility guarantee scales with $\sqrt{n}$

questions.text: Consider datasets:X= {x1, x2, ..., xN} (truth), Y = {y1, y2, ..., yN} (revealed values). To derive better estimators Z = {z1, z2, ..., zN} from Y, What process is required?
options: Removing bias from Y introduced through randomization
Adding bias to Y removed through randomization
Removing variance from Y introduced through randomization
Adding variance to Y removed through randomization
questions.correctAnswer: Removing bias from Y introduced through randomization

questions.text: Which factors directly influence the privacy guarantee in differential privacy mechanisms? Select all that apply.
questions.correctAnswer:
Sensitivity of the query function
Magnitude of added noise
Privacy parameter Epsilon

questions.text: Which trust scenario correctly describes the differential privacy model?
options: Trust the curator; Trust the world
Do not trust the curator; Trust the world
Trust the curator; Do not trust the world
Do not trust the curator; Do not trust the world
questions.correctAnswer: Trust the curator; Do not trust the world

questions.text: For fixed privacy levels, how do sample size requirements differ between Laplacian mechanism and Randomized response?
Higher privacy guarantees can be achieved in which scenarios? Select all correct options.
options: When variance in the mechanism is high
questions.correctAnswer:
When noise magnitude is increased
When variance in the mechanism is high

questions.text: In the context of randomized response, what happens to utility as privacy guarantees increase?
options: Utility decreases due to increased noise
questions.correctAnswer: Utility decreases due to increased noise
